channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold has crushed stocks, bonds and even bitcoin in 2025. This banking giant just got more bullish.
item.description: UBS Global Wealth Management strategists see plenty of drivers to keep pushing gold beyond the record run it has seen in 2025.

item.title: Chinese EV maker XPeng said it narrowed loss on record sales
item.description: Chinese EV maker XPeng said it narrowed its losses as revenue more than doubled in the second quarter.

item.title: ‘I can only rely on myself’: How do I protect myself from my parents’ nursing-home bills?
item.description: “I learned a long time ago that I could only rely on myself.”

item.title: I’m single, 75, and living with kidney disease and a pacemaker. I’ve no long-term care insurance. Will I be OK?
item.description: “My income is $120,000 per year which includes $60,000 in Social Security and a pension.”

item.title: Should AI flatter us, fix us, or just inform us?

item.title: GEPA optimizes LLMs without costly reinforcement learning
item.description: Moving beyond the slow, costly trial-and-error of RL, GEPA teaches AI systems to learn and improve using natural language.

item.title: Hugging Face: 5 ways enterprises can slash AI costs without sacrificing performance
item.description: Ultimately, model makers and enterprises are focusing on the wrong issue: They should be computing smarter, not harder.

item.title: The looming crisis of AI speed without guardrails
item.description: The future will arrive with or without our guardrails. We must design AI’s structures now for a future of abundance rather than disruption.
